programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes capped a big day with 291 yards passing and three touchdowns on a gimpy ankle. Mahomes went 5 for 5 on the only drive of overtime. Chiefs running back Kareem Hunt finished it off, along with his 106-yard rushing performance, by plunging into the end zone from 2 yards out to give Kansas City a 30-24 victory on Monday night over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Witness three brutal battles where toughness meets technique: Itso Babulaidze vs. Bryan McDowell - A high-octane clash between rising contenders. programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the roses in his garden, harvests honey from his bees and gives advice on the maintenance of hardy geraniums as well as planting others for summer groundcover. Rachel de Thame shows how the most ordinary of spaces can be transformed by adding seasonal containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from the Malvern Spring Show where Monty Don, Carol Klein and Rachel De Thame bring the very best that the show has to offer. From planting and design in the show gardens, to new and exciting varieties in the floral marquee, they search out beautiful and innovative ideas to draw inspiration from.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Longmeadow with inspirational ideas and plants gathered at the Malvern Spring Show. He has tips and advice for planting bearded irises and then turns his attention to the pond where he shares ideas on different types of water lilies and how to plant them. Meanwhile, Carol Klein delves into the quirky world of ferns, discovering them in the wild and admiring their variety.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planting out his tender annual plants into a container for colour and interest all summer long. He is also busy in the vegetable garden with tips and advice on how best to grow cauliflowers and protect them so that you get to eat them before the birds and caterpillars do. Meanwhile, Carol Klein answers an unusual dilemma from a gardener who lives in a lighthouse.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden springing into life and new blooms opening each day, it gives Monty Don plenty of opportunity to get on top of all the seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. With a postbag full of gardening dilemmas, Carol Klein helps out one viewer with propagation queries. There's also a look behind the scenes with Rachel de Thame as she races to get the Royal barge planted up for the Thames Diamond Jubilee Pageant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the summer solstice so the days are the longest of the year and the sun is at its highest. With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don is in his borders replacing plants like wallflowers that are past their best with other annuals that will give colour right through to autumn. Meanwhile, Carol Klein will be answering a viewer's letter with advice on gardening to provide a habitat for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don reveals how the garden has changed over the last four weeks and gets to grips with a variety of jobs in the walled garden. Meanwhile, Carol Klein celebrates the hardy geranium and visits East Lambrook Manor, a beautiful garden that is host to a stunning array of this cottage garden stalwart.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame gets a preview of the gardens in the Olympic Park and meets those who have battled the elements to make sure they are at the peak of perfection; Carol Klein discovers London's wild side, exploring a community garden in the centre of the city that provides a haven for both flora and fauna; Joe Swift makes an exclusive visit to the historic garden at 10 Downing Street.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals what to plant for fragrance during summer before turning his attention to his herb garden, cutting back marjorman, rosemary and thyme to ensure abundance for the rest of the summer, and sharing tips on how to propagate culinary herbs. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame seeks out intoxicating scents on a visit to RHS Harlow Carr.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the garden reaches an abundance of growth in August, it's the pond, hedges, and edges of the garden which are the focus of attention. In the pond the growth of algae is at its height, so Monty recommends some plants which will eventually improve the quality of the water and help to prevent this unwelcome growth. He also gets going on cutting the hedges and mowing the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is heading offshore into the Gulf of America, eager to feed his offshore fishing obsession.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson heads out to Crystal River, FL for a hot summer bite.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What makes you a better angler? It’s all in the details. Capt. Justin, Meredith McCord and Jeff Lange from Florida WaterSports go through the why, how and what to rig for different scenarios that bring success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick is joined by legendary frontman guitarist Dean Ween aka Mickey Melchiondo and Capt. Pat Murphy to hit the Jersey grounds to fluke fish and talk rock star passions.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick Joins Fisherman Magazine friends Dave Degenarro, Austin Perilli and Nicky DeGenarro for a reuniting of the Jersey families chasing the elusive Barnegat Bay weakfish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is fishing in the Northern Indian River Lagoon with DOA Lures Founder, Capt. Mark Nichols.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Goin' Coastal

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick is joined by legendary frontman guitarist Dean Ween aka Mickey Melchiondo and Capt. Pat Murphy to hit the Jersey grounds to fluke fish and talk rock star passions.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick Joins Fisherman Magazine friends Dave Degenarro, Austin Perilli and Nicky DeGenarro for a reuniting of the Jersey families chasing the elusive Barnegat Bay weakfish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is fishing in the Northern Indian River Lagoon with DOA Lures Founder, Capt. Mark Nichols.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Faith of My Fathers

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Postcards From the Edge
programme.desc: A very real mother-daughter relationship and rivalry set against the backdrop of late 1980’s Hollywood. Based on Carrie Fisher's best-selling novel.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: A disastrous drunken episode lands a successful New York journalist in rehab where she encounters a bizarre assortment of characters and rituals.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Shockproof
programme.desc: Jenny Marsh (Patricia Knight) is a hard-luck dame who's just finished five years in the slammer for killing a man. Jenny's not exactly the murdering type -- she did the deed while defending her jailbird lover, Harry (John Baragrey), which is probably one reason she's attracted the attention of her parole officer, Griff Marat (Cornel Wilde). In fact, Griff is so taken with Jenny that he gets her a job caring for his ailing mother, but although Jenny tries to fly right, she's not yet over Harry.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who can’t measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Square Shooter
programme.desc: A cowboy framed for the murder of his uncle sets out to bring the real killers to justice after his release from jail.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: On the eve of her wedding, a wealthy woman gets caught in a bind when her ex-husband and a handsome reporter make an appearance in her life.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A tennis star with an uncooperative wife and a wealthy man who wants to be rid of his father meet and make a deal on a Washington-to-New York train.

programme.title: North By Northwest
programme.desc: A lethal case of mistaken identity plunges a New York ad man into a race across the continent as he's pursued by foreign spies out to kill him.

programme.title: Kings Row
programme.desc: Small town scandals inspire an idealistic young man to take up psychiatry.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: Tom Thumb
programme.desc: A six-inch-tall boy takes on a pair of comical crooks.

programme.title: The Falcon in Danger
programme.desc: The Falcon investigates the mysterious disappearance of three men and $100,000 from a cross-country airliner.

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Abbott and Costello are on an island with deadly pirates.

programme.title: Sergeant York
programme.desc: Recruited to fight in World War I, a Tennessee farmer with deep pacifist beliefs is driven to take up arms when his unit is overwhelmed by Germans.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
programme.desc: A family relocates from the city to the suburbs. Challenges ensue when a damaging play review leads a famed actress to target the husband.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: A housemaid's romance is complicated by labor disputes in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate
programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: Because someone’s gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: The Roaring Twenties
programme.desc: Three friends return from World War I to the United States in the era of jazz, speakeasies and bootleggers.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team investigate a Russian sleeper agent involved with Abby's brother; Sebastian goes to Washington, D.C., to work with Abby; Bishop drives all night to deliver a package and help the New Orleans team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The staged suicide of a petty officer turns out to be murder; the team secretly works on an online dating profile for Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Mardi Gras celebration at Pride's bar is cut short when he and Mayor Douglas Hamilton (Steven Weber) are abducted by unknown assailants.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Evidence suggests that the man responsible for saving a lieutenant's life is a soldier who was captured in Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team uncover a domestic drug ring -- led by Sonja's childhood friend, Marion Watkins (Samaire Armstrong), that is producing cocaine.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy captain is murdered during an appearance on a local radio show; Pride's daughter comes home to talk about her plans for the future.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Agent Brody sees a connection between the case of a sailor struck by a party bus and the death of her sister; the team gets ready for the city's St. Patrick's Day celebrations.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride's daughter is attacked on campus, the team finds a surveillance van loaded with pictures of the special agent's every move.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates when a Navy lieutenant is murdered during a traditional funeral procession in the French Quarter honoring the recently deceased.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant dies during a secret visit to a general's hotel, agent Pride and the team are asked to break protocol for the investigation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio sets out on a personal mission to find his mentor's killer, and Megan worries that he has become too emotionally involved in the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Megan examine the remains of a human torso found in a tiger shark's stomach. Wanda De Jesus guest stars.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy family uses their power and influence to distance themselves from a rape and murder investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A priest is shot to death in his church rectory; Horatio and Delko examine the charred remain of a pregnant woman.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate the murder of a 5-year-old girl in a restaurant washroom.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence on a lost, blood-soaked toddler leads the CSI team to her home where each family member's spilled blood tells a tale of horror. Wanda De Jesus guest stars.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team tries to get inside the mind of a sniper after three people are shot and killed in downtown Miami.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate after the corpse of an unidentified girl is found near an extremely strict rehabilitation camp.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the stabbing death of a prostitute who is found stuffed under a bed in a hotel room.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Speedle investigate the manufacture of lethal drugs at mobile labs; an elderly woman is murdered at a senior citizen home.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A serial rapist is found dead of suffocation; investigators probe the murders of a crematorium owner and a girl found behind the crematorium.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Team members meet an environmental lawyer who has radiation poisoning after they are exposed to radiation during an investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Routine disposal of drug evidence goes horribly wrong, leaving two police officers dead and the CSI team under investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man stands trial for a murder he didn't commit, while Horatio and the team race to find the real killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mr. Las Vegas, Wayne Newton, takes to the block to see cars from his personal collection go under the hammer, including a one-of-a-kind '81 Mercedes Benz 380SL custom, a '99 Rolls Royce Silver Seraph and a '79 Rolls Royce Silver Shadow.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson hits the road running as it celebrates 50 years of spectacular cars in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Chevys and Fords strive to break past six figures on the auction block as various vehicles sell for no reserve at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The attention shifts to American-made rides as an incredible selection of Dodges, Chevrolets, and Fords crosses the auction block, with options ranging from a 1939 Ford Custom Roadster to a 1956 Ford Thunderbird Convertible.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidders battle it out as they try to gain ownership of the one-of-a-kind cars coming across the auction block in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bidders compete over one of the greatest collections of Ford Shelbys in Barrett-Jackson history, as well as a wide offering of Chevys; Craig Jackson and Steve Davis give an inside look at the 1976 custom Ford wagon, El Chapo.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Two hydrocars, including a 1965 Amphicar Convertible, cross the auction block along with Blackwings, two of the most powerful Cadillacs ever built, which are sold for a good cause.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mr. Las Vegas, Wayne Newton, takes to the block to see cars from his personal collection go under the hammer, including a one-of-a-kind '81 Mercedes Benz 380SL custom, a '99 Rolls Royce Silver Seraph and a '79 Rolls Royce Silver Shadow.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson hits the road running as it celebrates 50 years of spectacular cars in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Texas gives a history lesson as cars like the Ford Phaeton four-door convertible come across the auction block, showing car lovers just how far things are from horses and buggies.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Porsche is featured in this episode along with some of the greatest vehicles the world has ever seen, all auctioned at no reserve in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The wheels are spinning as Barrett-Jackson descends on Las Vegas for the 2022 season; highlighting bidders beating the odds and taking home collectible cars.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Barrett-Jackson Live auctions continue in Texas, introducing custom cars to the auction block; from a 1962 Chevrolet Corvette to a 1956 Ford F-100 Big Window, there is a car of choice for all car loves at the Houston auctions.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Lone Star State does not disappoint as the Barrett-Jackson live auctions continue in Houston, Texas; attention shifts to luxury cars as models like the 2014 Bentley Continental GTC and 1991 Ferrari 348 TS Targa come across the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From a 1971 Custom Chevy C-10 Deluxe Pick-Up all the way to a 1984 AM General M923 6x6, there is an option for every pick-up lover.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Scottsdale Auction heats up on Super Saturday as customs, classics and moderns drive across the auction block; from a 1929 Ford Model A custom roadster to a 2020 Ford Shelby, bidding is in full swing with prices soaring into six figures.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle is far from over as logging's toughest season winds down; Jesse questions the future of the family business; rumors of a pullout abound for the Gustafson crew; the Pihl crew celebrates a good year; a Stump Branch logger quits.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As dawn breaks over the Pacific Northwest, this year's Ax Men prepare for the battle that lies ahead. Behind every turn, danger lurks.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle is far from over as logging's toughest season winds down; Jesse questions the future of the family business; rumors of a pullout abound for the Gustafson crew; the Pihl crew celebrates a good year; a Stump Branch logger quits.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle has just begun, and already, men are bowing out of the race.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Ax Men soar to new heights as a helicopter logging outfit enters the competition. At Pihl, Dustin tries to talk his father into coming back to work.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, the bosses clash over greenhorn Brad. Meanwhile, at the Pihl team, Dwayne is forced to do the job of a greenhorn.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The mountain's men face the firing squad. Rygaard's greenhorn fights to keep his job, but the bosses may pull the plug before he gets his chance.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The mountain seeks its revenge. Weather traps R&R's helicopter pilot in the fog. Trees fight back against Pihl's timber fallers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The tables are turned and the mountain's underdogs get their chance. Jimmy Smith finds the holy grail of underwater logs when he attempts to pull a dock out of the water.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Dead weight must be shed. Inexperienced hook tender Jesse Browning, junior pilot Steve Smith, and greenhorn Brad Hewitt.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Handwritten lyrics for "My Country, 'Tis of Thee;" a World War II-era Linemar Space Explorer toy; a United Nations helmet from Somali; a giant bell from the historic El Rancho Hotel and Casino.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Replica swords signed by "Kill Bill" actor David Carradine; a first-edition of T.S. Eliot's "Four Quartets;" a 1965 Battle of the Bulge board game; a 1920s radium crock.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are back in San Bernardino, and Barry brings a good luck charm that yields a tasty reward. Darrell has a case of bidder indecision, while Jarrod and Brandi find out that big wins just may come in small packages.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers venture into Downtown, Los Angeles, where they find themselves in a new kind of auction, called a vault auction. It's pallets and crates instead of lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Family tensions ping as the buyers head to Ontario, California. Darrell Sheets wants to take son Brandon to the next level of auction buying, and he's willing to do it at Jarrod and Brandi's expense.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the wealthy beach neighborhood of Westminster, CA. Darrell Sheets brings his bravado and a wad of cash, and leaves with both of them intact. Dave Hester finds classic car parts.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers roll into the wide open desert in Hemet, California. Barry Weiss tries to kill Dave's "Yups" with kindness. Jarrod and Brandi make their mark on the competition with a tattoo locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head back to Ontario, CA and if people didn't notice Dave Hester before, they won't have any trouble now. Jarrod Schulz reverts to his previous ways, overpaying on some toys that make it hard for him to break even.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Long Beach, CA. Jarrod and Brandi have never done well here, so will their luck change? Darrell Sheets finally gets some exercise in Long Beach, buying for the first time and "wiggling" his way into the black.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers invade the quiet town of Simi Valley, CA. Darrell and Brandon smoke the competition. Jarrod and Brandi find some safes, "release the Kraken," and walk away with literally a pirate's booty.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers negotiate the desert winds of Lancaster, CA. Jarrod arrives cocky, and it's annoying Brandi.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Tempers flare in the storage aisles of Montebello, CA. Barry Weiss loses a battle with a bot. Darrell Sheets goes on a run.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buying takes root in Gardena, CA. Barry Weiss captains a ship, and almost goes down with it.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers blow into Santa Ana, CA. Barry Weiss climbs aboard the buying express. Dave Hester may have trouble leaving the station. And one buyer finds something that's got magic.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit Laguna Niguel, Calif.; Jarrod and Brandi discover some toys; Ivy Calvin tries to climb out of a hole; Barry tries his luck on a safe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey plan to spare no expense in order to fill up their truck; Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store becomes the subject of gossip; Ivy's latest score could affect his career.

programme.title: Best of #6
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog juggles his job and family responsibilities at the same time. He leads the search for Robert, a low-level drug dealer who makes money by selling hedge clippings as marijuana and broken Macadamia nuts as crack.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Dog's birthday, and he plans to celebrate in the same way he has for the last twenty years. There's no taking the day off to indulge himself for this bounty hunter--he's tracking down a fugitive!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's relentless ruthlessness is being put to the test on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog is tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the cameras are turned around.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: After the verdict comes in, at the last minute, Erik Menendez and his brother, Lyle, are sent to separate prisons. Erik marries and begins to mount an appeal. Will his case be given another chance?

programme.title: Sentenced to Life: Teen Killers
programme.desc: Journalist Susanna Reid follows the cases of juveniles convicted of some of the most shocking crimes imaginable, including Joshua Phillips, who was just 14 when he was convicted of brutally murdering his 8-year-old neighbor.

programme.title: Killer Teens
programme.desc: The frightening phenomenon of murder committed by teenagers.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: In 1989, 21-year-old Lyle and 18-year-old Erik Menendez walked into their parents' den and killed them. In this limited series premiere, Erik Menendez himself shares in stunning detail the events of the week leading up to the murders and the motive behind the crime that shocked America.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
